item.title: David Gergen, adviser to 4 presidents, dies at 83
item.description: David Gergen worked in the administrations of Presidents Richard Nixon, Gerald Ford, Ronald Reagan and Bill Clinton as a speechwriter, communications director and counselor to the president, among other roles.

item.title: South Carolina honors Robert Smalls with first statue of a Black man at the Capitol
item.description: The South Carolina Capitol grounds will soon include a statue of Robert Smalls, a formerly enslaved Civil War hero, among the statues of five white men, most with ties to the Civil War or Jim Crow.

item.title: Preliminary report says fuel switches were cut off before Air India Boeing 787 crash
item.description: Indian investigators determined the Boeing 787 Dreamliner was properly configured and lifted off normally. But three seconds after takeoff, the engines' fuel switches were cut off.

item.title: 2 years ago, Amanda Anisimova put down her racket. Now she's in the Wimbledon final
item.description: Anisimova was a teenage tennis prodigy. But by 2023, tournaments had become "unbearable" for her mental health, and she stepped away. Now, she is a win away from her first Grand Slam title.

item.title: At a Massachusetts cafe, helping the community is on the menu
item.description: A couple transformed a neglected storefront in Fall River, Mass., into a cheery cafe where they organize food pantries, neighborhood cleanups and a community fund for those who can't afford a meal.

item.title: Russia Intensifies Its Air War in Ukraine
item.description: Russia ratcheted up air attacks by drones and missiles on Ukraine this week. The increase comes as President Trump has expressed frustration at Russian President Vladimir Putin's seeming unwillingness to enter talks to end the war. Trump indicated the U.S. would resume shipments of weapons to Ukraine that had previously been suspended. Our correspondent in Kyiv gives us the latest.

item.title: Sumy, a center of Ukrainian culture, lives in the crosshairs of a new Russian offensive
item.description: The northern regional capital has become a frequent target of Russian drones, missiles and guided bombs. Now, Ukraine's top general says at least 50,000 Russian troops have massed across the border.

item.title: Part war propaganda, part comic strip, Bayeux Tapestry to return to U.K.
item.description: On a state visit, France's president announced the loan of the tapestry embroidered with scenes of the 1066 Norman invasion. It will return to the U.K. for the first time in more than 900 years.
